intro: Parepigynum funingense, commonly known as the Funing mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories at higher elevations.
